subject: Sleep
title: Arctic Animals and Midnight Sun
description: A quick, practical guide to Arctic Animals and Midnight Sun.

hook.text: In the Arctic summer, the sun never sets for months. How do animals sleep when there's no night?

buildup.text: Reindeer lose their circadian rhythm during polar summer and winter, sleeping in random short bouts.

discovery.text: Their melatonin production becomes flat instead of cycling, effectively turning off the circadian clock seasonally.

twist.text: This gives them a survival advantage. They can forage continuously during the brief Arctic growing season.

climax.text: Arctic animals prove that circadian rhythms are flexible adaptations, not rigid biological requirements.

punchline.text: When the sun never sets, the body clock stops ticking.

quiz.question: How do reindeer handle sleep during the midnight sun?
options: Their circadian rhythm shuts off and they sleep in random short bouts
